action.action-desc: Mrs. Kim of California (for herself, Mr. Curtis, and Mr. McGovern) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To provide for a review of sanctions with respect to Hong Kong.

section.header: Review of sanctions with respect to Hong Kong

subsection.header: Determination with respect to imposition of sanctions
subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the President shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a determination, including a detailed justification, of whether any person listed in subsection (b) meets the criteria for the imposition of sanctions pursuant to—

paragraph.text: section 1263(b) of the Global Magnitsky Human Rights Accountability Act (22 U.S.C. 10102(b));
Executive Order 13818 (50 U.S.C. 1701 note; relating to blocking the property of persons involved in serious human rights abuse or corruption);
section 7 of the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act of 2019 (22 U.S.C. 5701 note; Public Law 116–76);
section 6 of the Hong Kong Autonomy Act (22 U.S.C. 5701 note; Public Law 116–149); or
Executive Order 13936 (22 U.S.C. 5701 note; relating to Hong Kong Normalization).

subsection.text: In this Act, the term appropriate congressional committees means—

paragraph.text: the Committee on Foreign Relations and the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate; and
the Committee on Foreign Affairs and the Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives.
